event.title: was founded as San José del Pilar by a French Argentine agronomist, Adolfo Sourdeaux, on May 18, 1864

data.event: Part of a vast estancia estate owned by General Ángel Pacheco, San Miguel was founded as San José del Pilar by a French Argentine agronomist, Adolfo Sourdeaux, on May 18, 1864.

event.title: was built along the town in 1870

data.event: A Buenos Aires-Pacific Railway line was built along the town in 1870, and its first schools were opened at that time as part of President Domingo Sarmiento's program for education in Argentina.

event.title: was designated as county seat for the newly created General Sarmiento Partido in 1889

data.event: The town was designated as county seat for the newly created General Sarmiento Partido in 1889, and was in turn made the county seat for San Miguel Partido when the former was subdivided in 1994.
The town was designated as county seat for the newly created General Sarmiento Partido in 1889, and was in turn made the county seat for San Miguel Partido when the former was subdivided in 1994.
